Reason for Disease: Caused by Venturia inaequalis, a fungal pathogen thriving in wet and humid conditions.
Prevention: Prune trees for airflow, apply fungicides, and clean fallen leaves.
Suggestion: Choose resistant varieties like Liberty or Enterprise.
Info Over the Disease: Affects leaves and fruit, leading to reduced yield and quality. Dark scabs form on leaves and fruit.

Reason for Disease: Caused by the bacterium Erwinia amylovora, spreading via rain and insects.
Prevention: Prune infected branches, disinfect tools, and avoid nitrogen over-fertilization.
Suggestion: Use bactericides and monitor during blooming.
Info Over the Disease: Affects blossoms, branches, and fruit; branches may appear scorched or blackened.

Reason for Disease: Fungal infection caused by Podosphaera leucotricha. Favored by warm, dry climates with high humidity.
Prevention: Apply sulfur-based fungicides and maintain good orchard hygiene.
Suggestion: Ensure proper tree spacing for good air circulation.
Info Over the Disease: Forms white powdery patches on leaves, buds, and fruit, hindering growth.

Reason for Disease: Caused by the fungus Monilinia vaccinii-corymbosi. Survives in soil and infects during early spring.
Prevention: Rake and remove fallen berries, apply mulch, and spray fungicides.
Suggestion: Choose resistant cultivars and monitor during bud break.
Info Over the Disease: Causes berries to shrivel and turn white, reducing yield.

Reason for Disease: Fungal disease caused by Botrytis cinerea, thriving in wet weather.
Prevention: Improve drainage, remove infected debris, and use fungicides.
Suggestion: Reduce overhead watering and increase air circulation.
Info Over the Disease: Affects blossoms and fruit, leading to gray mold formation.

Reason for Disease: Caused by the soilborne pathogen Phytophthora cinnamomi. Develops in poorly drained soils.
Prevention: Improve drainage, avoid overwatering, and use resistant rootstocks.
Suggestion: Apply fungicides during susceptible periods.
Info Over the Disease: Roots turn black and decay, causing plant stunting and death.

Reason for Disease: Fungal disease caused by Monilinia spp. Infects blossoms and fruit during wet conditions.
Prevention: Prune trees to improve airflow, remove infected fruit, and apply fungicides.
Suggestion: Avoid overhead irrigation during bloom and fruit ripening.
Info Over the Disease: Forms brown spots on fruit, eventually rotting the entire fruit.

Reason for Disease: Caused by the fungus Blumeriella jaapii. Common in wet spring weather.
Prevention: Apply fungicides early in the season, clean fallen leaves, and prune infected branches.
Suggestion: Rake fallen leaves to reduce reinfection risk.
Info Over the Disease: Small purple spots appear on leaves, causing defoliation and reduced fruit yield.

Reason for Disease: Caused by Pseudomonas syringae, spreading through wounds and pruning cuts.
Prevention: Use copper-based sprays, prune in dry weather, and apply wound sealants.
Suggestion: Avoid planting in poorly drained soils.
Info Over the Disease: Leads to branch dieback, cankers, and gumming on branches.

Reason for Disease: Fungal disease caused by Exserohilum turcicum. Develops in humid conditions.
Prevention: Plant resistant varieties, rotate crops, and apply fungicides.
Suggestion: Avoid planting corn in the same field consecutively.
Info Over the Disease: Causes long gray-green lesions on leaves, reducing photosynthesis and yield.

Reason for Disease: Caused by the fungus Ustilago maydis. Infects through wounds or injuries.
Prevention: Avoid injuring plants, rotate crops, and remove infected plants.
Suggestion: Grow resistant hybrids and ensure balanced soil fertility.
Info Over the Disease: Forms large, black galls on ears, leaves, and stalks, reducing yield.

Reason for Disease: Spread by aphids and infected seeds.
Prevention: Control aphids, plant virus-free seeds, and eliminate weed hosts.
Suggestion: Use resistant varieties and monitor for aphid activity.
Info Over the Disease: Causes stunted growth, mosaic-like discoloration on leaves, and reduced kernel formation.

Prevention: Use resistant varieties
Suggestion: Improve vineyard airflow

Prevention: Remove infected parts
Suggestion: Disinfect tools

Prevention: Apply fungicides in spring
Suggestion: Remove infected leaves

Reason for Disease: Fungal infection
Prevention: Remove infected fruits
Suggestion: Plant disease-resistant varieties

Suggestion: Regularly inspect plants
Info Over the Disease: Blight causes dark spots on potato leaves and stems, caused by Phytophthora infestans.

Reason for Disease: Excess soil moisture
Prevention: Improve drainage
Suggestion: Use raised beds
Info Over the Disease: Root rot is caused by Phytophthora, affecting plant roots in overly wet soil.

Prevention: Apply fungicides when needed
Suggestion: Monitor weather forecasts
Info Over the Disease: Asian soybean rust is caused by Phakopsora pachyrhizi, leading to leaf yellowing.

Reason for Disease: High humidity and poor airflow
Prevention: Use sulfur or fungicides
Suggestion: Increase spacing between plants
Info Over the Disease: Powdery mildew is a fungal disease causing white powdery spots on leaves.

Reason for Disease: Wet and humid conditions
Prevention: Ensure good airflow
Suggestion: Remove infected berries
Info Over the Disease: Gray mold on strawberries is caused by Botrytis cinerea, affecting fruit quality.

Reason for Disease: Calcium deficiency
Prevention: Maintain consistent watering
Suggestion: Avoid drought stress
